Hi everyone. I'm Jennifer from
English with Jennifer. We're going to

study basic English grammar.
Are you ready? You can learn with my
students Flavia and Andreia.

Okay. Do you remember the word "fault"?
Fault.

If i say it's my fault, then it's my
mistake.

I'm wrong. I'm sorry. It's my fault. My
fault. I'm sorry.

Right. Um, so right now,
I'll show you some pictures There are

accidents, and it's all my fault.
Okay? And you can help me and you can
give me advice. All right? Advice

is information to help me. Right?
Information because you care.

You want to help me, so, for example, if i
say,

"Ah! I broke all the eggs. I wasn't paying
attention.

I was rushing. I dropped all the eggs,
and I broke them. Your advice?

Is it good to rush? Not always.
So, you're going to help me, and I want

you to give me advice
with "should." SHOULD is a nice word

to help people. Right? SHOULD +
another verb. You can do

"should," or you can do the negative
"should not" and the contraction becomes

"shouldn't." Should.
Shouldn't. Shouldn't.

I was rushing, and I dropped the eggs. I
broke them.

I was rushing. So, what's your advice?
"Jennifer, you...shouldn't rush."
You shouldn't rush. You shouldn't rush. Be careful.
You shouldn't rush. Okay? You should be
more careful. You shouldn't rush. I'll try. Thank you.

Ah! I spilled coffee
all over my papers. I had
my coffee mug...I put my coffee mug on my papers,

and then I knocked the mug over, and the
coffee went everywhere

because I put my mug on on the papers.
What's your advice? You shouldn't put

your mug on the papers. You shouldn't
put your mug on important papers. I know.

I forgot.
So, um, I have a little accident.

I drove off the road because uh
I was texting maybe. Yeah.
But everything's okay.

You shouldn't...you shouldn't more...
more attention? No...
You should...you should pay attention. You should pay attention.

Yes, and you shouldn't...yeah.
You shouldn't talk with...

You shouldn't talk on the phone and you
shouldn't text.
Text when you're....

when you're driving. You shouldn't text
when you're driving. Yeah. We can laugh,

but it's actually very serious. Right?
No texting. You should never...and for
emphasis, to be strong, we can say "never." You should

never text. You should never
text when you're driving.

You should never text. So, you
can say, "You shouldn't text,"
but to be very strong: You should never... Not "shouldn't never" but
"you should never." You should never text

while you're driving. When you're driving
you should always pay attention.

Right? It's important. We use the modal
verb

SHOULD to give advice. Giving advice
is telling people what we think is a
good idea. You should pay attention. You should be
more careful.

Notice how we use SHOULD + the base
verb.
Look at these sentences. Do you see any mistakes?

Don't use the infinitive after "should."
Let's take out "to." You should take care
of yourself. You should exercise more.
How do we form the negative?

We use "not." You should not stay up late.
You should not eat junk food.

In everyday English, especially
conversation,

we use the contraction, the short form.
You shouldn't stay up late. You shouldn't
eat junk food. You can practice more with Flavia and Andreia.

So, let's give more advice. I'll tell you
all my problems.

Okay? And you can tell me advice. I'm so
tired.
What's your advice?
You shouldn't work a lot. Okay. Yeah. You should work less.
Um, my stomach hurts.
You should take medicine. you should take medicine. Yeah. You should take medicine.
My throat hurts.
You should drink hot tea. Mm. Okay.
My arm hurts from
using my phone.
You shouldn't...so you shouldn't
use your phone a lot. Yeah. You shouldn't use your phone a lot.
Yeah. Okay. Um...
I'm bored. You should to go out. You should go out. Yeah. Be careful.

One mistake that happens with a word
like SHOULD

is we do SHOULD with a verb: should go,
should talk.

Don't use the "to." Not "should to go out."
Should go out. You should go out.

You should turn on the TV.
Or you should read a book. Right?

Can you give me more advice?
I miss my old friends from high school.

I live in Massachusetts, and they live in
Pennsylvania.
It's far away. What should I do?

Some possible answers: You should call
them.

You should stay in touch. You should
connect through social media.

Here's another problem. I love chocolate
cake,

but sometimes after I eat it, my stomach
hurts.
What should I do?

You might say, "Jennifer, you should eat
just a little."

"You shouldn't eat a lot. You shouldn't
eat it often."

Here's one more problem. Sometimes my
neck hurts.
What should I do?

Some possible ideas: You should buy a
better pillow.

You should do some exercises for your
neck.
You should stand up straight.
When you have problems, do you talk about them?

Do you ask for advice? Listen
as Andreia and Flavia share some problems
and give some advice.

Okay, so I told you all my problems. I'm
tired, my stomach hurts, my throat hurts,
I'm stressed. You gave me advice. Okay? Now we'll tell

the truth and talk about
us. Right? What's your problem? Can you
share one little problem?

In america, I gained weight.
You gained some weight. Some weight.
Yes. Yes. So, are you asking for advice?

You want advice? Yes. Advice. I need it.
She needs advice. You shouldn't worry.
You shouldn't worry. Okay.

You should look in the mirror...yeah...and
you should say,

"I look great!" Yeah. Okay. Thank you.
But you should eat healthy.
Yes. Yes. So, vegetables, fruits, not cookies and cakes. Yeah. Yeah.
But not a lot of chocolate. Yes. You shouldn't stop eating.

You should eat, but eat healthy. On the
other hand...
on the other hand, you don't eat vegetables. Oh.
You should eat...so...you should...You should eat more vegetables.
Good advice. Okay. Thank you. No, you should say thank you! Thank you.
Do you have a little problem? I go to sleep

late. You go to sleep late. I go to sleep
late. So, are you tired now? Yes.
Do you want advice?
What is...? You could say, "What's your advice?" What your advice...what's your advice?
What's your advice?
You...
You should sleep early. You should go to sleep early. I think she should go to the gym

in the evening, get tired...yeah...and go to
sleep.
Yeah. So you should exercise at night,

and then you'll feel tired, and you'll go
to sleep.

Yeah. But she doesn't like that.

So you...
You shouldn't...
see...look? Look...look your phone. Look at your phone.
